definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: And, he defined a term called the electronegativity.
sentences.chinese: 于是他提出了电负性这个理论。

sentences.english: So there is a difference in electronegativity.
sentences.chinese: 所以这他们之间有电负性差。

sentences.english: And so, this is a schematic of the electronegativity scale.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这是电负性大小的示意图。

sentences.english: Which of those two is more electronegative? The oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 它们两个中哪个有更高的电负性？氧。

sentences.english: So carbon is to the right of hydrogen, this is more electronegative.
sentences.chinese: 碳在氢的右边，所以它较氢更是电负性的。

sentences.english: Intermediate electronegativity is great, and the adsorption amount is great as well.
sentences.chinese: 证明分子筛的平均电负性大的，吸附量也大。

sentences.english: That makes lead dioxide much more electronegative than classical theory would predict.
sentences.chinese: 二氧化铅的电负性其实比古典化学理论认为的要更强。

definition: alkaline earth (i.e. beryllium Be 鈹|铍, magnesium Mg 鎂|镁, calcium Ca 鈣|钙, strontium Sr 鍶|锶, barium Ba 鋇|钡 and radium Ra 鐳|镭)
